meanings.definition: A strip of material used for binding or confining items together.
meanings.sent1: I used a rubber banding to hold my papers together.
meanings.sent2: The banding around the gift box made it look neat and tidy.
meanings.sent3: The banding on the book was so tight, it looked like it was wearing a belt!
meanings.sent4: The banding on the tree trunk resembled a colorful bracelet.
meanings.sent5: The banding on the package kept everything secure during shipping.

meanings.definition: The act of forming a band or group.
meanings.sent1: The banding of musicians played beautiful music at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The banding of friends made the hiking trip more enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: The banding of students in the school play was a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The banding of birds in the sky created a mesmerizing pattern.
meanings.sent5: The banding of volunteers helped the community event run smoothly.

meanings.definition: The process of marking or identifying with bands of color.
meanings.sent1: The banding of the birds helped researchers track their migration.
meanings.sent2: The banding of the products with different colors made them easy to distinguish.
meanings.sent3: The banding of the zebra crossing made it look like a rainbow road.
meanings.sent4: The banding of the flags added a festive touch to the event.
meanings.sent5: The banding of the test tubes helped organize the lab experiments.
